title: Toru Yoshida
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager.
Playing career.
Yoshida was born in <a href="Shiwa%2C%20Iwate">Shiwa, Iwate</a> on May 17, 1965. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="JEF%20United%20Chiba">Furukawa Electric</a> (later "JEF United Ichihara") in 1984. He played many matches as side back from 1986 and the club won the champions <a href="1986%20JSL%20Cup">1986 JSL Cup</a> and <a href="1986%20Asian%20Club%20Championship">1986 Asian Club Championship</a>. This is first Asian champions as Japanese club. In 1995, he moved to <a href="Japan%20Football%20League%20%281992%E2%80%9398%29">Japan Football League</a> club <a href="Vegalta%20Sendai">Brummell Sendai</a>. He retired end of 1997 season.
Coaching career.
After retirement, Yoshida became a coach for <a href="Sony%20Sendai%20FC">Sony Sendai</a> in 1998. In September 2001, he became a manager as <a href="Kazuaki%20Nagasawa">Kazuaki Nagasawa</a> successor. He managed the club until 2003. In 2006, he signed with <a href="Japanese%20Regional%20Leagues">Regional Leagues</a> club <a href="Iwate%20Grulla%20Morioka">Grulla Morioka</a> based in his local <a href="Iwate%20Prefecture">Iwate Prefecture</a>. He managed the club until 2011.
